title: Bank of England
creator_credit: John Spencer, John Wiles, Bank of England and Films of Today
brief_description: An account of the history and day-to-day functions of the Bank of England and its role in financing Government and industry. Ludovic Kennedy, the presenter, explains the Bank’s role as Government broker and banker, its tasks in issuing Treasury bills, exercising exchange control, keeping the gold reserves, acting as banker to the major clearing banks and printing the country’s supply of banknotes.
